intro: Olyra longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf olyra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Olyra longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
